title: How much sugar in blood should there be? - Quora

response.answer_text: A healthy individual will carry 1 gram of sugar per 1 liter of blood. Usually we have 5 to 6 litres of blood in our body…which means we carry about 5 to 6 grams of Sugar. Which indiactes a healthy amount of sugar in body….increase in this level ( even after extended periods after meal) indicates diabetes complications.

Blood sugar is pretty variable. In normal individuals, it may range from 60 mg/dL after fasting for 10 hours to about 250 mg/dL for a short time following each meal. Insulin levels generally follow blood sugar levels very closely.
